name: 歐洲電影史
description: This course aims to offer a chronological overview of European cinema. Major moments, directions and tendencies, as well as major genres, directors, and achievements, will be reviewed, with a view to thoroughly familiarizing students with the specificity of European cinema.
goals: Understand specific aspects of the visual representation through the medium of cinema in Europe.
Become more familiar with aspects of European modernity.
syllabus:
1.     Introduction: film in the European context

2.     Early experiments: developing a new visual art

3.     The rise of the early national cinemas

4.     Cinema and art: impressionist, expressionist and other in-roads

5.     Fantasies and experiments of the 1920s

6.     Film and politics in the interwar period

7.     In the wake of destruction: Neo-realism

8.     Transatlantic re-connections: the art of the noir

9.     Depicting the Other: imagining the world behind the Iron Curtain

10.  Auteurs: Bunuel, Bergman

11.  Auteurs: Fellini, Antonioni

12.  The French New Wave: Truffaut, Godard

13.  Art and politics in European cinema of the 1970s and 80s

14.  The Soviet cinema

15.  The German New Wave: Wenders, Fassbinder, Herzog

16.  New technologies, new avenues

17.  Major European film festivals

18.  “European” as a category: specificity in European cinema

methodologies.note: Most screening will be individual, with classes dedicated to lectures and discussions. Students will be required to watch a certain number of films every week and keep blogs about what they have watched.

grading.note: Movie watching blogs/Moodle postings & reading feedback
